page.title: 03FEATURES - MARTON & N'THORPE
page.content: St Mary's Nunthorpe is the oldest church in the block. Other two are St. Bernadette's R.C. and Nunthorpe Methodist Church. Each has its own hall which serves for social events. Gypsy Lane and Guisborough Rd. are both crossed by the{Esk Valley Railway {Line.}At Gypsy Lane the crossing is unmanned and controlled by lights. At the manned crossing at Nunthorpe shops there is a barrier. At both points passengers may alight from or board trains. There are three main{shopping {areas.}The most substantial of these is at Marton. Nunthorpe is well served and there are several shops near to The Avenue. There are three {public {houses}within walking distance - The Southern Cross, The Brunton Arms and The Rudds Arms.{Captain James Cook {R.N.}was born in a cottage sited near The Rudds Arms.
